title: Bringing the holiday offering late
vignette: Someone missed offering the festival offering on the first day of the holiday. May it be brought later in the week?

options.text: Yes, bring it any day of the holiday.
No; it must be on day one only.

title: Using portion set aside money for offerings
vignette: A traveler wants to use his second portion set aside funds to pay for the holiday offering instead of regular funds.

options.text: Permitted; it's still special status use.
Not allowed; second portion set aside must be eaten, not offered.

title: Travelers exempt from appearing
vignette: Someone is lame in one foot but can hobble to the main city. Is he required to make the journey to a central place?

options.text: Yes if he can manage the trip.
He is exempt due to difficulty.

title: Studying mystical teachings
vignette: A group of students want to delve into esoteric topics like mystical teachings during the holiday. Their teacher hesitates.

options.text: Allow if they are mature and prepared.
Discourage; such study is restricted.

title: Visiting the Central Assembly Place while contaminated
vignette: A person who became contaminated from touching a dead body won't be able to purify in time for the holiday. May he still enter the central assembly place courtyard?

options.text: No entry; contamination bars him.
Allow entry to watch from a distance.

title: Excessive rejoicing
vignette: Some groups dance wildly in the central assembly place courtyard, bordering on disrespect. Should administrators intervene?

options.text: Let the joy continue; it's the holiday spirit.
Restrain them to maintain reverence.

title: Teaching unready students
vignette: A bright but immature youth begs to learn deeper secrets during the holiday gatherings.

options.text: Teach him gradually despite concerns.
Decline until he matures more.

title: Offering without proper utensils
vignette: Travelers arrive but the central assembly place is short on knives for ritually preparing. Should offerings be delayed?

options.text: Wait until utensils are available.
Use whatever tools they have.

title: Charitable giving instead of journey to a central place
vignette: A poor family cannot afford travel to the main city. They propose donating the cost to charitable giving instead.

options.text: Charitable giving can replace the journey to a central place this year.
They must still attempt the journey.

title: Carrying infants to the Central Assembly Place
vignette: Parents debate bringing their baby to the main city, unsure if small children count toward the command to appear.

options.text: Bring the child to introduce them early.
Leave infants home; only adults are obligated.

title: Borrowing animals for offerings
vignette: Someone without livestock wants to borrow a friend's animal to bring as a festival offering.

options.text: Borrowing is fine if repaid later.
Each must offer his own property.

title: Offering from stolen funds
vignette: An individual regretfully admits that his holiday offering money came from dishonest business. Should he proceed?

options.text: Use the money anyway and repent later.
Do not bring an offering from stolen funds.

title: Exchanging offerings for money
vignette: Prices for animals in the main city soar. Travelers wonder if they can give cash to the central fund instead of buying overpriced animals.

options.text: Yes; money offerings are acceptable in a pinch.
No; animals are required despite the cost.

title: Abstaining from Food on the holiday
vignette: A group feels remorseful and wishes to period of abstaining from food a day of the holiday for reconciliation.

options.text: Abstaining from food is inappropriate; eat and rejoice.
Allow a private period of abstaining from food if heartfelt.

title: Staying overnight in The Main City
vignette: After bringing the offerings, may travelers return home the same day or must they sleep in the city?

options.text: They must stay overnight at least once.
They may depart immediately if desired.
